TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., The Austin Papers, (Austin: University of Texas Press, 1927), 3 vols., Vol 3, pp. 162-163
TEI.2.document_author: Doctors Wiliam P Smith, Thomas P Gazley et Al
TEI.2.document_title: Doctors Wiliam P Smith, Thomas P Gazley et Al to J H Moore, 10-07-1835

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., The Austin Papers, (Austin: University of Texas Press, 1927), 3 vols., Vol 3, pp. 162-163

div1.p: To John H. Moore Commanding Col.

You are hereby requested to accept the medical services of the undersigned, who without any distinction of grade, have with a special eye to the good of their country, constituted themselves a board for the volunteer army of Texas— With sentiments of high consideration we subscribe ourselves yours sincerely.
